bibl.title: Dispatch from L de R. du Verge to J.C. Bancroft Davis
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.note: No 10. Ackd Oct 20/ 82 (See report of Oct 18/82) Received Oct 7 1882
div1.p: L de R. de Verge to Dept of State
Subjects Nominations of U.S. Consular agent
Objects Preventing wrongfully discharge of American steamer ga
United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda Augt 11. 1882.
The Honorable J.C. Bancroft Davis Asst. Secty of State Washington D.C.

Sir I have the honor most respectfully to state what Mr "J Laurentine Jones of Mossamedes," Richard Foster of Ambriz" and "J. H. Vieria da Silva of Benguella" were appointed by me U.S. Consul agents for said district unti the approval and confirmation of the state Department.

These gentlemen are the most respected ad wealthiest traders of the above mentioned places, possessng sugar, coffee, and cotton plantations and are the best resident that I have found upon inquiring able to represent the U.S. with honor.

My reasons in doing so have already been stated to the Dept.
29
in the despatch No. 11, 12, 13,14, 14, and have had since two cases of and Cape de Verde Islands steamer deserting from amL Whalers at little fish bay, and coming upon this consulate as destitute, but in both cases I( was able to allow them with their own consent to be shipped immediately on Portugese vessel and tare to this consulate and the U.S. govt. trouble and expences.
I have now a very sick seaman left at the hospital by the U.S. Vice Consul Mr. Newton which I will try to habe forwarded by this mail to Cape Verde place of his residence
I have the honor to be Sir Your most obedient servant L de R. du verge U.S. Consul
